article.headline: Salesforce.com Inc., Boeing share gains lead Dow's 510-point rally
article.body: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is rallying Wednesday afternoon with shares of Salesforce.com Inc. and Boeing seeing positive momentum for the price-weighted average. The Dow DJIA, +0.56% is trading 510 points (1.8%) higher, as shares of Salesforce.com Inc. CRM, +2.21% and Boeing BA, -0.39% have contributed about a third of the index's intraday rally. Salesforce.com Inc.'s shares are up $10.47 (4.2%) while those of Boeing have climbed $4.87, or 3.0%, combining for a roughly 101-point bump for the Dow. Also contributing significantly to the gain are Intel INTC, -1.03%, UnitedHealth UNH, +1.68%, and 3M MMM, +0.94%. A $1 move in any one of the 30 components of the benchmark results in a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
